name: debug
description: Print messages and/or variable values for troubleshooting.
remarks:
- Accepts either a **string shorthand** (printed as a message) or a **full options object**.
- `msg` entries support template expressions rendered against `ctx.variables` (via `evalExpr`).
- When `var` is provided, values are looked up from `ctx.variables` using dot-paths (e.g. `"app.version"`).
- If nothing is provided, prints a default `"ok"` line.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description:
Text to print. Accepts a single string or an array of strings.
Entries support expression syntax.

parameters.name: var
parameters.description:
Variable name or list of names to print from variables.
Dot-paths are supported, e.g. `"app.version"`.

parameters.name: vars
parameters.description: Inline values to include in the output. Printed as JSON (pretty by default).

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Optional header line prepended to the output.

parameters.name: quiet
parameters.description: If `true`, do not logâ€”only return the output.

parameters.name: changed
parameters.description: Force the returned `changed` flag in the result.

examples:
# String shorthand
- name: quick debug
  debug: "Hello from Katmer ðŸŽ‰"

# Multiple messages with expression evaluation
- name: deployment banner
  debug:
    msg:
      - "deploying {{ app.name }}"
      - "version {{ app.version }}"

# Show specific variables (dot-paths allowed)
- name: print variables
  debug:
    label: "context"
    var:
      - "app.name"
      - "env.stage"

# Inline values and compact output
- name: inline map (no pretty)
  debug:
    pretty: false
    vars:
      region: "eu-east"
      replicas: 3

# Quiet mode (no logger output, result only)
- name: return only (no logs)
  debug:
    msg: "this is silent"
    quiet: true

returns.name: changed
returns.description: Whether this module changed anything on the target.

returns.name: failed
returns.description: Whether the module failed (non-zero exit code, validation failure, etc.).

returns.name: msg
returns.description: Human-readable message describing the outcome or error.

returns.name: attempts
returns.description:
Number of attempts performed so far (e.g., by `until`).
Typically increments from 1 upwards.

returns.name: retries
returns.description:
Maximum retries allowed for this operation (e.g., by `until`).
This reflects the configured ceiling, not the attempts taken.
